title: Fix remaining Lucene/Solr Javadocs issue
description:
Java 8 has a new feature (enabled by default): http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/172 It fails the build on: incorrect links (@see, @link,...) incorrect HTML entities invalid HTML in general Thanks to our linter written in HTMLTidy and Python, most of the bugs are already solved in our source code, but the Oracle Linter finds some more problems, our linter does not: missing escapes < invalid entities Unfortunately the versions of JDK8 released up to today have a bug, making optional closing tags (which are valid HTML4), like

, mandatory. This will be fixed in b78. Currently there is another bug in the Oracle javadocs tool (it fails to copy doc-files folders), but this is under investigation at the moment. We should clean up our javadocs, so the pass the new JDK8 javadocs tool with build 78+. Maybe we can put our own linter out of service, once we rely on Java 8

comments.content:
Uwe: would it be easy to setup a jenkins instance running the full build using JDK8, just w/o the build failure email notifications?

then even people w/o JDK8 installed (or the inclination to constantly keep up with the beta builds) could still see look at the list of doc failures/warnings under JDK8 and help out with fixes.
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content:
I think realistically the

tag bug, combined with the lack of copying doc-files would make the output somewhat useless today. If they can fix these two bugs, i'm sure we can easily fix any remaining real issues quickly. Then we are able to see if we still encounter the hotspot bug where it miscompiles something and causes all tests to fail....
comments.author: Robert Muir

comments.content:
We already have a JDK8 build, so there is no action to take. I am just waiting for the confirmation from Oracle that the bug with doc-files is fixed. The number of fixes needed on our side is small, I will take the issue once a functional JDK8 is out. The issue with optional end elements (

) is already fixed in their b78 branch.
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
The Javadocs doc-files issue is: http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=8008949 (this is not my original bug report, but according to Jon Gibbons they had some problems with the bug tracker).

b78 is now out, I will try out and start to fix Javadocs issues.
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
[trunk commit] Uwe Schindler
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1451295

LUCENE-4797: For now disable javadoc-lint provided by JDK8, so we can enable recent JDK8 builds on jenkins. Our own doclint is already disabled, so the missing doc-files don't matter!
To test and fix bugs with JDK8, run ant javadocs -Djavadoc.args=-Xdoclint:all
comments.author: Commit Tag Bot

comments.content:
I committed a workaround for those bugs a minute ago. We can now run jenkins with build 78.

Unfortuantely, we cant't because the class library has a bug: in rt.jar, the method isAnnotationPresent(Class) is missing! Test framework does no longer compile, Solrj also fails. I'll dig.
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
[branch_4x commit] Uwe Schindler
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=revision&revision=1451296

Merged revision(s) 1451295 from lucene/dev/trunk:
LUCENE-4797: For now disable javadoc-lint provided by JDK8, so we can enable recent JDK8 builds on jenkins. Our own doclint is already disabled, so the missing doc-files don't matter!
To test and fix bugs with JDK8, run ant javadocs -Djavadoc.args=-Xdoclint:all
comments.author: Commit Tag Bot

comments.content: There is another problem in JDK8 b78, I opened LUCENE-4808 about it. Otherwise the code and javadocs now compile.
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
FYI, we reenabled Java 8 builds, so the javadocs produced by Java 8 pass our own JTidy/python doclinter. But we disabled Java8's own doclint. We should work now towards making the HTML clean and pure HTML4 (no XHTML, which is disallowed by Java! So no
)
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
I made some progress on many of the silly issues. but we have to disable some checks:


-Xdoclint:all -Xdoclint:-html -Xdoclint:-missing



To enable html, we have to fix the stuff Uwe describes here. To enable missing, we have to add missing param/return/throws/everything. But we at least reject totally broken stuff, and the linter is FAST
comments.author: Robert Muir

comments.content: Also, of course the checks are only in trunk. But the idea is, things fail fast (much faster than precommit checkers), so it actually makes it easier on the developer to iterate there.
comments.author: Robert Muir

[ https://svn.apache.org/r1658042 ]

LUCENE-4797: backport html fixes (no doclint setup here yet, since java7 is supported)
comments.author: ASF subversion and git services

comments.content:
I think in branch_5x we can still enable doclint for the javadocs call easily. common-build.xml conditionally enables -Xdoclint:none there. So we can simply change that to the same options like in trunk. The doclint:none was needed to prevent failures on Java 8.

A similar condition culd be used for javac and then we have all features. I am just not 100% sure if javac allows doclint with -source/-target 1.7. But its worth a try.
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

comments.content:
Patch that enables doclint on java 8+ in branch_5x, but no-op on java 7.
I will run the whole build now, to assure Robert did not miss any files and commit this.

Maybe we should forward-port the separation of the properties javac.doclint.args and javadoc.doclint.args to trunk, too. In trunk there would be just no condition. Comments?
comments.author: Uwe Schindler

+1 on forward porting those args.
